title: (amended by section 28 of the Act of 2022), section 45 (amended by section 38
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Assisted Decision-Making
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Assisted Decision-Making 
(Capacity) Act 2015 (Inspection of Registers and Receipt of Copies of 
Documents) Regulations 2023.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited assisted decision-making (capacity) act 2015 (inspection register receipt copy documents) regulation 2023

title: (amended by section 28 of the Act of 2022), section 45 (amended by section 38
heading: In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations – 

“Act of 2005” means the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (No. 
27 of 2005); 

“Act of 2011” means the Nurses and Midwives Act 2011 (No. 41 of 2011); 

“Act of 2014” means the Companies Act 2014 (No. 38 of 2014); 

“Act of 2015” means the Legal Services Regulation Act 2015 (No. 65 of 
2015); 

“Principal Act” means the Assisted Decision-Making (Capacity) Act 2015 (No. 
64 of 2015); 

“public body” means – 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

a Minister of the Government, 

a local authority within the meaning of section 2 of the Local 
Government Act 2001 (No. 37 of 2001), 

a body (other than a company formed and registered under the 
Act of 2014 or an existing company within the meaning of that 
Act) established by or under any enactment, or 

a designated institution of higher education within the meaning 
of section 2(1) of the Higher Education Authority Act 2022 (No. 
31 of 2022).
text_norm: 2 regulation - act 2005 mean health social care professional act 2005 (no 27 2005) act 2011 mean nurse midwife act 2011 (no 41 2011) act 2014 mean company act 2014 (no 38 2014) act 2015 mean legal service regulation act 2015 (no 65 2015) principal act mean assisted decision-making (capacity) act 2015 (no 64 2015) public body mean - (a) (b) (c) (d) minister government local authority within meaning section 2 local government act 2001 (no 37 2001) body (other company formed registered act 2014 existing company within meaning act) established enactment designated institution higher education within meaning section 2(1) higher education authority act 2022 (no 31 2022)

title: (amended by section 28 of the Act of 2022), section 45 (amended by section 38
heading: 3. Subject to Regulation 4, the following bodies or classes of persons are
text_raw:
3. Subject to Regulation 4, the following bodies or classes of persons are 
prescribed for the purposes of sections 25(3)(a), 25(4)(a), 45(3)(a), 45(4)(a), 
72(3)(a) and 72(4)(a) of the Principal Act: 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 2nd May, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [206] 3 

(a) 

a public body; 

(b) dietitians, being persons whose names are for the time being 
entered in the register of members of the profession of dietitian, 
established and maintained under section 36 of the Act of 2005; 

(c) 

dispensing opticians, being persons whose names are for the 
time being entered in the register of members of the profession 
of dispensing optician, established and maintained under section 
36 of the Act of 2005; 

(d) medical scientists, being persons whose names are for the time 
being entered in the register of members of the profession of 
medical scientist, established and maintained under section 36 of 
the Act of 2005; 

(e) 

(f) 

occupational therapists, being persons whose names are for the 
time being entered in the register of members of the profession 
of occupational therapist established and maintained under 
section 36 of the Act of 2005; 

optometrists, being persons whose names are for the time being 
entered in the register of members of the profession of 
optometrist established and maintained under section 36 of the 
Act of 2005; 

(g) persons who – 

(i) 

have been admitted as, and are, members of a prescribed 
accountancy body within the meaning of section 900(1) of 
the Act of 2014, 

(ii) 

are currently practising in the profession of accountancy, 
and 

(iii) are maintaining such minimum level of professional 
indemnity insurance as is required by the prescribed 
accountancy body concerned; 

(h) physiotherapists, being persons whose names are for the time 
being entered in the register of members of the profession of 
physiotherapist, established and maintained under section 36 of 
the Act of 2005; 

(i) 

(j) 

practising barristers within the meaning of section 2(1) of the 
Act of 2015; 

practising solicitors within the meaning of section 2(1) of the 
Act of 2015; 

(k) pre-hospital emergency care practitioners, being persons whose 
names are for the time being entered in the register of prehospital emergency 
care practitioners, established and 
maintained under Article 4(s) of the Pre-Hospital Emergency 
Care Council (Establishment) Order 2000 (S.I. No. 109 of 
2000); 

(l) 

psychologists, being persons – 

 
 4 [206] 

(i) who practise as such, 

(ii) who hold a qualification listed opposite the profession of 
psychologist in the third column of Schedule 3 to the Act 
of 2005 or a qualification that is a corresponding 
qualification, within the meaning of section 90 of that Act, 
to that qualification, and 

(iii) following the establishment under section 36 of the Act of 
2005 of a register of members of the profession of 
psychologist, whose names for the time being are entered 
in the register; 

(m) 

radiographers and radiation therapists, being persons whose 
names are for the time being entered in the register of members 
of the profession of radiographer, established and maintained 
under section 36 of the Act of 2005; 

(n) 

(o) 

(p) 

(q) 

(r) 

(s) 

(t) 

(u) 

(v) 

registered dentists within the meaning of section 2 of the 
Dentists Act 1985 (No. 9 of 1985); 

registered medical practitioners within the meaning of section 2 
of the Medical Practitioners Act 2007 (No. 25 of 2007); 

registered midwives within the meaning of section 2(1) of the 
Act of 2011; 

registered nurses within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Act 
of 2011; 

registered pharmacists, being persons whose names are for the 
time being entered in the register of pharmacists, established and 
maintained under section 13 of the Pharmacy Act 2007 (No. 20 
of 2007); 

registered proprietors of an approved centre within the meaning 
of Part 5 of the Mental Health Act 2001 (No. 25 of 2001); 

registered providers of a designated centre within the meaning 
of section 2(1) of the Health Act 2007 (No. 23 of 2007); 

regulated financial service providers within the meaning of 
section 2(1) of the Central Bank Act 1942 (No. 22 of 1942); 

social workers, being persons whose names are for the time 
being entered in the register of members of the profession of 
social worker established and maintained under section 36 of the 
Act of 2005; 

(w) speech and language therapists, being persons whose names are 
for the time being entered in the register of members of the 
profession of speech and language therapist established and 
maintained under section 36 of the Act of 2005.

title: (amended by section 28 of the Act of 2022), section 45 (amended by section 38
heading: 4. A body or a class of persons prescribed by Regulation 3 shall –
text_raw:
4. A body or a class of persons prescribed by Regulation 3 shall – 

 
 
 [206] 5 

(a) 

include nominees of the body, or of a member of the class of 
persons, and 

(b) not include an individual body or person, as the case may be, 
who does not have a legitimate interest in inspecting the details 
of the relevant Register (within the meaning of section 25, 45 or 
72 of the Principal Act, as the case may be) that are specified by 
the Director. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 April, 2023. 

RODERIC O'GORMAN, 

Minister for Children, Equality, Disability, Integration and 
Youth. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [206] 

BAILE ÁTHA CLIATH 
ARNA FHOILSIÚ AG OIFIG AN tSOLÁTHAIR
